title: Have Been Carrying Out Raids In Lebanon For Months: Israeli Military
content: Israeli forces have been carrying out raids into southern Lebanon for months, uncovering Hezbollah tunnels and weapon caches under homes and uncovering invasion plans by the group, Israeli military spokesman Daniel Hagari said on Tuesday.
summary: Israeli forces have been carrying out raids into southern Lebanon for months, uncovering Hezbollah tunnels and weapon caches under homes and uncovering invasion plans by the group, Israeli military spokesman Daniel Hagari said on Tuesday.

title: "The Damage Is Done": Anger In Nepal Over Relief Delays As Flood Kills 225
content: Survivors of the monsoon floods that ravaged Nepal at the weekend criticised the government on Tuesday for inadequate relief efforts during a disaster that killed at least 225 people.
summary: Survivors of the monsoon floods that ravaged Nepal at the weekend criticised the government on Tuesday for inadequate relief efforts during a disaster that killed at least 225 people.

title: Book Excerpt | 'Boastful': How Terrorist Masood Azhar Spent His Time In Jail In India
content: Mohananey also said that Masood was aware and boastful about his importance. He apparently claimed that when he landed at Heathrow Airport in London, a massive crowd of followers came to see him, resulting in a two-hour traffic jam.
summary: Mohananey also said that Masood was aware and boastful about his importance. He apparently claimed that when he landed at Heathrow Airport in London, a massive crowd of followers came to see him, resulting in a two-hour traffic jam.

title: Nigerian Zookeeper Killed By Lion After Leaving Gate Open During Feeding
content: A zookeeper in Nigeria was mauled to death by a lion after he failed to secure the locks on its enclosure when he went to feed it.
summary: A zookeeper in Nigeria was mauled to death by a lion after he failed to secure the locks on its enclosure when he went to feed it.

title: Hezbollah Targets Mossad Headquarters, Military Base Near Tel Aviv
content: Lebanese militant group Hezbollah on Tuesday said it had targeted the Israeli military intelligence base of Glilot near Tel Aviv.
summary: Lebanese militant group Hezbollah on Tuesday said it had targeted the Israeli military intelligence base of Glilot near Tel Aviv.

title: Naked Trump Statue That Appeared In Las Vegas Vanishes Mysteriously
content: The statue, made of foam over rebar and weighing around 6,000 pounds, was designed as a marionette with movable arms.
summary: The statue, made of foam over rebar and weighing around 6,000 pounds, was designed as a marionette with movable arms.

title: What We Know About Israel's Ground Offensive In Lebanon
content: Israel announced Tuesday it had launched a ground offensive targeting Hezbollah in southern Lebanon, days after killing its leader Hassan Nasrallah in an air strike on a bunker in Beirut.
summary: Israel announced Tuesday it had launched a ground offensive targeting Hezbollah in southern Lebanon, days after killing its leader Hassan Nasrallah in an air strike on a bunker in Beirut.

title: Hawaii Sues Homeowner After His Beachfront House Falls Into The Ocean
content: The Department of Land and Natural Resources (DLNR) Office of Conservation and Coastal Lands reported that waves destroyed the Haleiwa home, causing debris to fall onto state land and into the ocean.
summary: The Department of Land and Natural Resources (DLNR) Office of Conservation and Coastal Lands reported that waves destroyed the Haleiwa home, causing debris to fall onto state land and into the ocean.

title: No Israeli Troops Have Entered Lebanon, Says Hezbollah Media Chief
content: The head of Hezbollah's media office, Mohammad Afif, said on Tuesday that no Israeli troops have entered Lebanese territory, and warned that the group's strikes on Tel Aviv hours earlier were "only the beginning".
summary: The head of Hezbollah's media office, Mohammad Afif, said on Tuesday that no Israeli troops have entered Lebanese territory, and warned that the group's strikes on Tel Aviv hours earlier were "only the beginning".

title: Elon Musk, Indian-American Billionaire Vinod Khosla's Heated Exchange On X
content: The argument stemmed from Khosla’s criticism of Javier Milei’s policies, much to the dismay of Musk, a vocal admirer of the Argentine leader.
summary: The argument stemmed from Khosla’s criticism of Javier Milei’s policies, much to the dismay of Musk, a vocal admirer of the Argentine leader.

title: Cruise On Which "Everything Went Wrong" Sets Sail After 4-Month Delay
content: A luxury round-the-world cruise ship beset with technical delays and docked in rainy Belfast since May finally departed from the Northern Irish capital late Monday, prompting celebration among its passengers.
summary: A luxury round-the-world cruise ship beset with technical delays and docked in rainy Belfast since May finally departed from the Northern Irish capital late Monday, prompting celebration among its passengers.

title: School Bus With 44 Students Catches Fire In Thailand, Multiple Feared Dead
content: A devastating fire tore through a Thai bus carrying 44 students and teachers on a school trip Tuesday, officials said, with up to 25 feared dead.
summary: A devastating fire tore through a Thai bus carrying 44 students and teachers on a school trip Tuesday, officials said, with up to 25 feared dead.

title: "I Am Free Today Because I Pleaded Guilty To Journalism": Julian Assange
content: Wikileaks founder Julian Assange on Tuesday said he was released after years of incarceration only because he had pleaded guilty to doing "journalism", which he described as a pillar of a free society.
summary: Wikileaks founder Julian Assange on Tuesday said he was released after years of incarceration only because he had pleaded guilty to doing "journalism", which he described as a pillar of a free society.

title: China Launches Missile Deep Into Pacific Ocean, First Such Test Since 1980
content: China launched an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) from its territory deep into the Pacific Ocean on September 25, the first such test since 1980.
summary: China launched an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) from its territory deep into the Pacific Ocean on September 25, the first such test since 1980.

title: "My Eyes Are Bleeding": Elon Musk Limits Visibility Of Bold Font Posts On X
content: Elon Musk, the owner of X, has advised users of the social media platform to refrain from excessively using bold fonts in their posts.
summary: Elon Musk, the owner of X, has advised users of the social media platform to refrain from excessively using bold fonts in their posts.

title: US Man Who Failed In Spanish Now Runs A Language School In Spain
content: A 36-year-old California man turned a short-term teaching stint in Spain's Mallorca into a successful new life, despite initially struggling with the language.
summary: A 36-year-old California man turned a short-term teaching stint in Spain's Mallorca into a successful new life, despite initially struggling with the language.

title: Disabled UK Journalist Forced To Crawl On Flight Due To Lack Of Wheelchair
content: A British journalist, who lost his legs in a 2004 war reporting attack, faced a humiliating and discriminatory experience on a LOT Polish Airlines flight.
summary: A British journalist, who lost his legs in a 2004 war reporting attack, faced a humiliating and discriminatory experience on a LOT Polish Airlines flight.

title: US Warns Iran Of "Serious Consequences" If It Attacks Israel
content: The United States Secretary of Defence, Lloyd Austin, spoke with Israeli Minister of Defence, Yoav Gallant and reiterated "serious consequences" for Iran if Tehran chooses to launch a direct military attack against Israel.
summary: The United States Secretary of Defence, Lloyd Austin, spoke with Israeli Minister of Defence, Yoav Gallant and reiterated "serious consequences" for Iran if Tehran chooses to launch a direct military attack against Israel.

title: US Man Thought He Could Save A Cruise Ship He Bought. Now It's Sinking

title: As Israel Begins Ground Invasion Of Lebanon, Lessons From 1982, 2006 Wars
content: Israeli forces today began "ground raids" in southern Lebanese villages, targeting Hezbollah strongholds. As the Israeli invasion begins, the ghost of past incursions into the Levantine nation is still fresh in the minds of its citizens.
summary: Israeli forces today began "ground raids" in southern Lebanese villages, targeting Hezbollah strongholds. As the Israeli invasion begins, the ghost of past incursions into the Levantine nation is still fresh in the minds of its citizens.
